scenario:
The Vanguard S&P 500 Growth ETF (VOOG) delivered a 38% return in 2024, more than double the S&P 500's 23% return. The ETF tracks the S&P 500 Growth index, which holds 233 top-performing growth stocks, including Nvidia, Apple, and Microsoft. These stocks have high weightings in the ETF, contributing to its outperformance.

The top five positions in the S&P 500 Growth index are: Apple (12.38%), Nvidia (11.67%), Microsoft (10.80%), Amazon (6.66%), and Meta Platforms (4.31%). The information technology sector has a 49.1% weighting in the Vanguard ETF, compared to 31.3% in the S&P 500.

Nvidia, as the largest supplier of AI graphics processors, is expected to benefit from the growing demand for AI chips and infrastructure, with companies like Microsoft, Amazon, and Alphabet planning to spend $300 billion on AI-related spending this year.

The Vanguard ETF has a compound annual return of 16.4% since its inception in 2010, outperforming the S&P 500's 14.1% return over the same period. If AI stocks continue to lead the market higher in 2025, the ETF is likely to outperform the S&P 500 again.

However, the ETF may temporarily underperform in the event of a stock market slump or economic shock, as high-flying growth stocks tend to fall more sharply. Despite this, there's no sign of an impending negative event, and the Vanguard ETF is poised for another strong year in 2025.
